summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation of telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document outlines the procedures for handling and processing the records, which are believed to contain information about potential underage victims associated with Epstein.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is mentioned as the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein, who is under investigation for obstruction of justice related to an address book containing names of potential underage victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is referenced as the subject of a child prostitution case, with connections to Alfredo Rodriguez and the investigation into potential underage victims.

connections.description: Alfredo Rodriguez served as the house manager and butler for Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a direct employment relationship.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez in October 2009.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and phone numbers of potential underage victims instead of turning it over to law enforcement.
The address book is believed to contain records related to Jeffrey Epstein and additional underage victims.
The document outlines procedures for scanning and processing telephone records related to the investigation.
